Excellent food!! Love this place! The bowls are excellent, especially the ranch dressing. I usually just get that to go with my meal... Even if I don't get the salad. Fantastic customer service and all around awesome :)
Used to be great. I feel like they went downhill. Their bowls used to be huge. Deep. Big. Now theyre half that size and the same price. Serious disappointment.

Not impressed. Heard people rave about this place so we decided to try it out. Maybe it was a bad day but everything was flavorless except the meat itself which was tasty. I had to use a crap load of hot sauce just to eat mine. The service was great and very friendly.

Drove by a couple days and was very intrigued. We came here for dinner tonight to try out this new locally owned Hawaiian-Mex fusion restaurant that has very similar layout to chipotle . As you walk in you are greeted aloha and asked if you have ever eaten at this restaurant. We said no they give us a couple samples of the 3 meats to choose from Kailua pork, steak, and chicken if you don't eat meat there are veg and fish options. But all three meats were amazing!! The pork and steak were my favorite. You can choose burrito, bowl, salad, or 3 tacos. I got a bowl since I love rice and I don't care for tortillas. I got the seaweed rice, half Kailua pork and steak, roasted corn salsa, pineapple verde salsa, cabbage, bean sprouts, sour cream, jalapeños, couple squeezes of lime and cheese. And drizzled pineapple hot sauce it's was delicious and I really didn't need the cheese for next time. The customer service was amazing everyone was so nice and friendly. We will definitely be back.

The service was very friendly, offered samples which was nice but the finished product not so happy with. We had the burrito with puleho steak. There was more vegetable than meat. The vegetables were largely sliced. Burrito fell apart with the second bite. Had to eat the rest with a fork. And the kahlua pork as a burrito with beans and cheese and all the makings of a burrito??? I don't think so. Never had kahlua like that. Didn't enjoy it for the price we paid.

First time trying this place...we loved it. We got the pig bowl and was surprised with the flavors. Must try their sauces with it. We got to sample the steak and chicken also and can't wait to come back for another round. Clean, friendly service and very helpful.
Wife and I loved it. Nice people who take alot of pride in their food.  Great flavors that would be easy for every one to find something to their liking at a price that won't break the bank.

One of my all-time favorite restaurants here. I crave their seaweed rice and mango habanero sauce on a weekly basis. I remember the very first time I went they offered me free samples of all the meats and were very helpful. They always deliver excellent customer service and top notch meals! Like I said, the only bad side is you'll crave their flavor ALL the time.

Priced good for what they offer. Service was where it should have been. Food was fresh and delightful. Not so personalized and flavorful as I would have expected as being a new individualized business. Give this expansion a year before closing the doors.
Best Kahlua Pork! Our entire family stops by here at least once a week. Their bark is also to die for!

love the atmosphere of the relaxation of Hawaii ... the foods are great n fresh.  i love eating at chipotle but this is different & has more choices. the meats products are a bit salty but favorful.  the sauces are fresh n good.  i love mine spicy, n theirs are pretty clean cut spicy choices. i will totally eat here again.

From the friendly staff to the delicious food,  you can't go wrong.  The grilled fish and chicken were smotheringlicious. We also got a taste of the coconut bark,  be warned, it's crack undercover, after your first bite you want more.  This place has my vote,  two thumbs up.

The huli huli chicken bowl was phenomenal...my family and I really enjoys this place. The music takes me back to the islands and the coconut bark is amazing! A+++++++++ for service, price (military discount), and overall quality of their food. Thanks!!!

I went around 9:30 they close at 10 pm . That makes it a decent time for them to make my food correct . I got 2 orders of 3 tacos . The fish was just a little piece . Most of it was burned and I had asked for corn crispy tortilla . They gived  me flour tortilla on all 3 , no sour cream , no lime , no ingredients that I asked for .  I live 5 minutes away from there . My food was completely cold. To me it was like they were in a hurry to get out of there and just gived me crap. I pay money for my food and I got trash .  I had one bite and I just had to trow it away . 
I usually check my food  before I live , this time I didn't because I trust  them . Last time!!!
Definitely  I won't ever go back to this location.  
I wanted to call but no point on driving back almost when they gonna close and get same crap 
No thank you!  So disappointed on this place.

This place is amazing!!  The staff is awesome and the food is out of this world. I have been a life long lover of chipotle but this place is on a level of its own. I suggest doing the steak and pig combo burrito. Their sauces are delicious as well.  I ended up buying a package of their hot sauces to take home. I do not see myself ever going back to chipotle again as long as this is an option.

Best tacos in town! Customer service is great. They let you sample all theirs meats prior to making a purchase. Try all the salsa's and taco sauces as well. I had lunch here three days in a row and was impressed every time. They are currently on Groupon, save some money.
Always great service and food. Love it :) go try it. The staff are trained right. The food is always fresh and you can't beat the fish!

Always good!  I used to frequent the warm springs location that's close to my job. I just moved up north and was pleased to find out there was one up here! Staff was cool and the burritos fat as always ha!
A nice Hawaiian spin on Chipotle/Qdoba-type burrito places...very yummy! I love the sweet/spicy blend...and don't miss out on the coconut bark! Delicious!

I came here for the first time they the drive thru--the popolo girl that took my order was rude. She also forgot my coconut bark, so I went in to get it. She had some attitude when I walked in and showed her my receipt. She just kept asking me if it was in the receipt. I said I just went thru the drive through and she repeated it back to me, to which she asked if it was on the receipt that I was showing her-she saw it and gave me the bark with no apologies--just attitude.

There are certain times when size DOES matter and this $9.30 salad did NOT measure up. Where was my chicken? Omg theres a hole still burning in my stomach from the habeneros? WHY is that even an option? EPIC miss. Tastes ok but not worth it! Del Taco salads taste better!

This place is the Hawaiian Chipotle.  The service was outstanding, as we had many items for takeout and they were very helpful.  All the ingredients are extremely fresh and tasty.  The steak and Kalua pigs were excellent, however I found the chicken and fish a bit bland (that cost the 5th star).  Overall; a very good place to get fresh, tasty takeout that is a little out of the norm.

I would probably give this place 3 stars if they weren't so darned friendly!  

Here's what I love about Braddah's:
- The service.  ALWAYS super friendly and accommodating! 
- The seaweed rice.  Very unique (and yummy) flavor.
- Their chicken and pork.  The steak is too sweet for me, but I love their chicken and pork.  Very flavorful and tender.
- The coconut bark.  Man oh man if I didn't think I'd blow up to 400 lbs, I'd be in there buying this stuff every day.  Soooooo good.

Here's where I think Braddah's could use some work:
- The tortillas.  If they made their own tortillas, or even just bought higher-quality tortillas, their tacos and burritos would taste 100% better.  Until they figure this out, I'll only be getting a salad or a bowl.
- The salsas and sauces.  The regular tomato-based salsa is pretty ok, but I haven't been impressed with any of their other salsas or sauces.  Blah.
- Pricing. It's nice that their pricing is simple until you realize you are paying the same price for your little salad as you are for a giant burrito.  And since I really hate their tortillas and will only get a salad or a bowl, I feel pretty jipped.

So there ya go!  Will I go back to Braddah's?  Yes.  Can they make some big improvements?  For sure.

Can't believe it took me so long to stop by here! I started to go through the drive thru but decided I wanted to go inside. The staff is beyond friendly. They asked if I'd been there before, I hadn't, so they started loading me up with free samples...and I'm now hooked! Amazing flavors, can't even explain it, you have to taste it for yourself. Kalua Pig is a pulled pork that is the best i have ever tasted, anywhere! Hope they stay in the neighborhood!

Wife and I just found this place, the food is fantastic with great flavors and large portions.  The manager at the Durango location is a great individual who obviously takes great pride in their food.  This is a definite new favorite location for us.

It was my first time coming here tonight. I went through the drive through and they asked if I would rather pull up to the window to sample the meat before I purchase. I tasted the steak, pork, and chicken. It was pretty good so I decided to go inside. I got a bbq steak burrito. It sounds weird but it blended well with the sour cream and salsa. The service was excellent and helpful. My burrito was awesome and I got really full before I even finished it which is usually not the case for me. I hope this place stays
Amazing food. Great for kids and the music is great. We had the steak bowl, burrito, salad, and tacos. Everyone brought home leftovers. The coconut bark was unbelievable.

Yummmmm! So the idea is like chipotle but hawaiian. Pick a bowl, burrito, tacos or nachos. Then you have a variety of rices, meats, sides, salsas and award winning guacamole to top it off. 

Huli hula chicken, kalua pig....mango salsa, seaweed rice..and for dessert coconut bark! O.M.G!!!

So I had a chicken bowl with cabbage, hot tomato salsa, seaweed rice and guacamole with jalapeños. Amazing!!

The employees are awesome too. So friendly and fun!!!

Since I'm a huge fan of traditional Mexican tacos, I was extremely skeptical of trying ones with a Hawaiian twist. I was able to sample the chicken and the steak to decide on my taco meats. The chicken was too salty for me, and the pulehu steak blew my mind away. It was well-marinated w/ unique flavors that I was pleasantly surprised. 

I had two tacos- one with pulehu steak and kalua pig.  I've never been too fond of kalua pig, but it was actually really good here with awesome texture. 

The coconut bark was mind-blowing, that I went back and bought a box several times within the following weak. It's dangerous, and to be frank, I ate so much of it that I'm now currently a bit tired of eating it. But it doesn't change the fact that it is a-maaaaaaazing.  

I'll DEFINITELY be back for more of that pulehu Steak, and the lava chips (blue corn tortilla chips) are SO good, that I bet the nachos are legit, too.

I forgot to add...their sauces/salsa kinda was mehhhhh. It tasted watered down and I'd skip it next time.

New location!

This one is next to my work so I'm happy that i get to enjoy it for my lunch break. Its smaller than the one on rainbow/sahara but the food and service is just as awesome. Glad they are doing so well. The owner caught us on the way out and personally thanked us for coming.

The service was great as soon as we walked in the girl was greeting up and offering us a taste of the meat. Menu was real simple ordering from and the food was pretty good. 
Went in after 1, didn't start getting busy until about 1:45pm.
Nice clean place to eat.

Steak is horrible, flavor is good but it's really low quality and extremely chewey. Got a buy 1 get 1 and it was still 13$ for two people, and the burritos are Half the size if what you would get at Chipotle. 
Service was good and the venue is clean but overall I would Not recommend you try this olace
Location on Maryland pkwy was super good !!!!! Excited to see a new location near me !!
My all time favorite!!! I probably come here at least twice a week and the food and service are on point!! Will and Darla make my experience and keep me coming back!!!

NEW OBSESSION ALERT! Braddah's Island Style blew me away! I had been reading the reviews of the other locations and Braddah's was definitely on my radar, but I never had a chance to make it in.

I happened to be in the area and saw that a new location was opening somewhat near me and I felt like that lady in the annoying Mervyn's commercial back in the day... OPEN! OPEN! OPEN! So I kept checking back to see when it was going to open and low and behold, today I saw that it was and IT WAS ONNNNN!!!!!

So I just tried their amazing food and I'm hooked! It was sooo good! It's fast casual style, a lot like Chipotle with the bowls, burritos, tacos or salads but with a way better vibe and food. The menu is a lot more creative with higher quality ingredients. Like seriously though. Soo OVER Chipotle. I had already been saying that anyway because their meat is so nasty. Tons of gristle. I'll never eat there again but thankfully I have an alternative. And a healthy alternative at that. 

So here's how it works:

Step 1 - Choose One - Burrito, Bowl, Salad, Tacos or Nachos

Step 2 - Choose One - Huli Huli Chicken, Kalua Pig, Pulehu Steak, Grilled Fish, Grilled Veggies

Step 3 - Choose Any - Seaweed Rice or Brown Rice, Black Beans, Grilled Veggies ($1.25)

Step 4 - Choose Any - Charred Pineapple Verde (Mild), Mango & Roasted Corn (Medium), Tomato with Grilled Maui Onions (Hot), Guacamole (Upcharge), Sour Cream, Cheese, Bean Sprouts, Lettuce, Purple Cabbage, Cilantro, Chopped Jalapeños or Habaneros

They also had some side sauces to choose from: Mango Habanero, Raspberry Jalapeño and Kiwi Jalapeño.

I had the Steak Bowl (pictured) and in mine I got: Pulehu Steak, Seaweed Rice, Black Beans, Charred Pineapple Verde, Cheese, Jalapeños, Habanero, Cilantro, & Bean Sprouts with Mango Habanero sauce. Highly recommend. I ate every last grain of rice.

They gave me a sample of their soon to be world famous Coconut Bark because I was a newb and WOW that stuff is fantastic! That salted caramel and chocolate with the coconut just melted in my mouth. It's won awards and I can see why.

I am so happy! I'm going to be like their best regular now. I wish this place was closer to me though. That's the only thing that sucks. But it's close enough. I'm going to make the trek because it's worth it!

Do yourself a favor and try the food here. It is soooooo friggin good, I can't even tell you.

Shaka Braddah! See you guys tomorrow.

Better than Chipotle hands down! And a nice healthier alternative to traditional local Hawaiian plate lunches.  Love the concept and most importantly the food and customer service. My first visit I decided to have the seaweed rice bowl with Huli Huli chicken and Kalua pork with beans, cabbage, guac, house made mango habanero chile sauce ...huge portion ...it was delicious! And the nice lady who helped me gave me 2 free samples of their coconut bark. I'm going back for Kalua nachos and the works! 5 stars if they had drive thru.

Me and my boy saw the OPEN sign went into the restaurant at 9:30pm, welcomed by 3 staff members asked what time they close they told me 10. Ordered Kailua pig quesadilla and steak bowl. The tortilla of quesadilla got burnt they apologize and said they are gonna fix it so no problem. They even offered taster food so that my boy can start eating. Didn't feel rushed and loved the relaxing atmosphere because it wasn't so busy. When we finally got the food, the manager handed  it over in a to go container and took good care of us. She apologized for the wait. They provided great customer service and owned up to their mistake with sincere apology plus made up for their mistake to make things right. We will definitely be back.
Have been to the one by UNLV so I was glad to see that there was one near my house. Friendly employees and good food, love the chicken bowl.

Food was great and excellent service! I had the grilled fish bowl, my husband had the steak burrito and my 2 year old had a chicken bowl. All great choices, staff working tonight 11/15/15 was very accomodating and friendly. We will definetely back :)

I decided to try this place because Mexican and Hawaiian infused sounded good. I got the bowl with seaweed rice, chicken, black beans, lettuce, tomato maui onion (a little spicy). The rice was a little hard and the chicken was a little salty. It was a decent meal. I'll probably try something different next time. The employee there was nice though, he offered to give us samples before we ordered so I really appreciate that!

I have heard so much positive feedback about this place. It just opened near my house and was excited to try. At lunch time, I was the only one in the restaurant. I didn't think the food served was anything to rave about. I order a burrito with the pig which had great flavor but the overall burrito was very plain. Marked it off my list and won't be back.

I wish there was something to write about here . I was imagining walking in that I'd be able to enjoy my love for Chipotle style burritos & bowls with a little Hawaiian flare - but a presence of flare there was not. The staff was emotionless and lifeless , just like the food. The best thing I ate was a cranberry agave sauce that I was given to me when i asked for HOT sauce. It was super sweet but wasn't even close to what I was asking for. I would never recommend this place . Save the money and just hit Aloha Kitchen.
It has really good food, the pork there I think is the best and they don't shy away from giving you a good size portion. I prefer this place over chipotle any day.

This place was amazing!! The lady there was so nice and let us try the meats before we decided what we wanted! I got the 2 taco lunch deal with kalua pig and chicken! Sooo yummy!! I also couldn't resist and got the nachos with kalua pig, that was to die for! I think the kalua pig was so much better than the steak or chicken but all the meat was good! It's a lot of food, they give you a ton of meat so it filled us up quick!! I will be going back when I visit my sister in Vegas!! Great place, food and service!!

Even though this is my first time here because the other was a little farther than I liked, I liked it a lot, the flavors reminded me of home. The employees were very nice and helpful with the menu, and also first timers get a free sample of their Coconut bark which is great, definitely coming back!!!!

Ordered a chicken burrito here and the gristly dark meat was so salty I practically went blind. I saw a huge bottle of liquid hickory flavoring behind the counter and I'm pretty sure they used the whole thing on the chicken. The black beans were good but all of the other ingredients were meh at best. Hot salsa looked like it came out of a Pace jar and had about as much kick as the lid. My fiancee had the fish tacos, with about the same luck. The word "inedible" came up.

Probably won't give this place a second chance.

I am a big chipotle fan and I love hawaiian food so I did expect alot.   Two of my favorite put into one but It was just ok. I was sorta disappointed.   Not alot of people there when we went but they did run out of the mango habanero sauce and the mixed veggies.  Really?   Got the bowl with seaweed rice and steak and was not impressed. I prefer chipotle over this.  And I prefer a traditional hawaiian place over this.  And I'm glad we took it to go because place was dirty.  Maybe I'll try it again but will call to make sure they have the veggies and mango sauce. ..bummer.

Great service!  As soon as I walked in I was greeted with an "ALOHA" (as a kama'aina I really appreciated that) Great food!  The Kalua Pig wasn't dry, perfectly cooked and delicious.  The seaweed rice was delicious and the corn was ONO!  I like how they played Hawaiian music in the restaurant, brings me back home.  I love this place!

I really really wanted to like this place, but i cant force myself to. The Kalua and huli huli chicken was VERY VERY salty, i could not finish my bowl. Trust me, i love salty food but not even I could handle it. Im disappointed because I love the chipotle concept mixed a hawaiian twist.  Wont be returning.
It is about time this area got excellent take out (or sit down) restaurant.  The pork tacos are to die for!  My picky kids will even eat here.   Yummy!
Kalua Pig, Huli Huli Chicken & Pulehu Steak was on point. Onolicious kine grindz. Glad I found this spot.

They are finally open! I've heard wonderful things about the location near UNLV,  so I was excited to see that a location opened up close to home.  The atmosphere and service are warm and welcoming and the food is flavorful.  The concept is similar to Chipotle  but oh so much tastier.

Wife and I had lunch here today. First time eating at this location. Were greeted warmly by the working staff who were also very helpful in teaching us the ropes of constructing our bowls.
Wife had the chicken and I had chicken and pork on top of the seaweed rice. With the other toppings, the flavor combinations were fabulous. The only thing I would call a problem is their location. Been traveling this road for quite some time and never noticed Braddah's in this tiny mall. The wife clued me in as we drove by a few days ago. This place is well worth looking for and coming to. They need word of mouth advertising and I hope this review will help pull others in.

I've heard so much about this place and was happy to see try opened a location in the SW. Too bad I didn't get to try anything because after waiting inside for 10 minutes, nobody was there to assist. Sad that the place was empty and I could have easily walked behind the counter to make it myself. Hope I can try again when someone is able to take my order.

I think the shopping center this is located in goes unnoticed.

Braddah's has so much potential! They just need a steady crowd to keep the food running out. The location by UNLV is always busy and they kill it!

The staff here is awesome and so friendly.

I did notice however that when I come in there's always one or more dirty tables, like they forget to wipe them down- but I know they aren't too busy so pick it up kids!

Any ways, I'll keep coming back if you keep making those pig tacos & bark!!!

Went on a Sunday afternoon. Both kinds of rice were not near being cooked which ruined both our meals. Raw rice is gross. Corn salsa looked like it had been out for days and the Guacamole was brown. Very disappointing since you could tell this place had potential. Pork was good, beef was ok. Smaller pieces tasted much better as the bigger they were the harder it was to chew. Pineapple salsa is pretty good. We both mixed up our bowls before tasting the rice so we couldn't eat more than a few bites of each. Both meals Ended up in the trash. Seems like food sits out for awhile so freshness could be a concern. Guys behind the counter didn't even seem concerned about the condition of some of the bins, raw rice, two pieces (yes two pieces) of brunt veggies and brown guac, oh and the tiny bit of wilted brown cilantro left. I definitely have the feeling this is not the norm because our bowls looked nothing like the pictures of other reviewers.

They give you an easy to understand menu to figure out what you're looking for. I ordered the rice bowl with their seaweed brown rice and grilled fish. I recommend if you get the fish, try it with the white rice instead. The seaweed rice was good, I just think it would have had a better taste with white rice. Overall, service was wonderful. We were the only customers that were there at the time. My boyfriend had a chicken burrito which was really great! However, we weren't completely full when we finish, so this was kind of a downer. Should have ordered a side to go with the meal.

I was craving a burrito bowl after a workout so instead of going to my usual stop, which was Chipotle, I opted to try Braddah's.  I love Hawaiian food so why not.

At 7pm on a regular Monday night, this place was just deserted. I think it was the location. There is only one other restaurant there in that plaza which was a Japanese place and even they do not look like there were getting a lot of business too. 

We walked in and were greeted warmly by everyone in store. They asked if it was our first time there and we said "Yes." They gave us a sample of each of their meats and recommended which sauce goes well with what. So we got two things: Huli Huli Chicken bowl with brown rice and a Pulehu Steak Burrito with the seaweed rice. 

Flavor wise, I loved it! Only concern - The food was actually pretty cold even though they prepared it in front of us. Maybe the meat was left out for too long? Given that they do not get as much business, the meat was a tad bit cold so I was disappointed about that. This has a potential to be really good but it just did not have that served hot and fresh factor that should come in all sit down places anyway. Even Subway offers to heat up your food, right? I do have to remember, however, that it is a fast food place.

So overall, I'd say meh. I would still give it three stars because of how nice the staffs were.  They even gave us free coconut bark for desserts.

This place has awesome food and excellent customer service!! I had the steak burrito and it was so yummy! When the staff found out that my coworker and I hadn't been there before they let us sample all their different meats!

I've been in love with Braddah's for a long time, but the only reason this specific location got 4 stars is because of consistency. My last two visit had things wrong with them. My last visit I got beans that needed more cooking cause they were only half tender and the rice had a couple of uncooked rice in them. The visit before that had chicken that was pretty dry, but that was slightly understandable cause I only saw one person working, so he most likely got distracted with orders while cooking them. I love Braddah's so I'll keep eating there no matter what, but I can't give 5 stars until they get the consistency right. Other than that no complaints and great food.

I found this restaurant while at the Bite of Las Vegas and tried their Pork Nachos and Coconut Bark and was blown away so then I looked up the locations and this happens to be just down the street from my house.

Located on the corner of Tenaya and Warm Springs, end cap of the retail space facing Warm Springs. The place is clean and friendly as you walk in and are greeted with Aloha! and the sound of Hawaiian music. 
There are several tables and bar table top settings however this location is not too big in size. There is an outside area set up for seating, however, every time I have been here there was not tables outside. 

The ordering style is basically a walk up to the counter and start at one side and work your way down the other as the employees prepare your tacos, burrito, nachos, or salads. Basically similar to any subway or cafe rio type system. 

The are quick to ask for extras and tell you any up-charges for certain items. 
I have had tacos; one steak, one pork, one chicken and also have had two burritos, one pork and one chicken since the times I have been here and all were great and of course made with the toppings and rice, salsa, etc, that I chose. 

I also love the Coconut Bark! its certainly a sweet so if that is not your taste than be ready because goodness of sugar, chocolate and coconut is coming at you. 

There is also a self service drink system with refills while your dinning in.

Again, I personally like this Hawaiian Food and find it better than a few other places in Vegas and of course the employees all have a great Hawaiian Spirit. 

Mahalo!!

First time visit disappointed
BEWARE
My daughter ordered Huli Huli
Chicken tacos and found a BIG chicken bone in her food.
Waited for other patrons to leave before I said anything.
No sorry no concern no nothing!
Luckily my daughter didn't choke on the 2" chicken bone.
Asked who was responsible for cutting up
Chicken - they need to be more careful !
All FIVE employees - said absolutely nothing.

I'm taking my money elsewhere where they care.



Well it's unfortunate that someone's safety and well being has to be taught to your "young leadership"! As well as their common sense and courtesy to at least acknowledge the issue; then show concern for your patron and at minimum an apology regarding the situation. 

NOT ONE of your staff whom varied in age offered an apology which leaves your patrons "the perception that there is no concern regardless of how long they have been in leadership".
Obviously they learned from you as your lack of sincerity comes through your response.

Three words....Everything Needed Salt 

We came for lunch during the week and it was completely empty at 12:30 in the afternoon. Only one other couple came in while we were dining in. 

I ordered a chicken salad and my husband got a pork burrito. The meats were the only thing I had that actually had salt on it, and a little too much at that. 

You can get romain or cabbage on your salad and I decided to mix the two for a little more texture and I am so glad that I did because almost everything else was over cooked and soggy. 

It's your basic diy: salad, bowl, burrito & nachos with some very similar toppings that you would see at chipotle only with a Hawaiian twist. 

I got fajita veggies: under seasoned &  incredibly soft and oily. 

The corn salsa: under seasoned, and the corn was overcooked and chewy. 

The pico: under seasoned & did not taste fresh. 

The salsas were all under seasoned. I tried them all and went back because after I started eating my salad I realized it needed some heat and I thought I had asked for the spicy salsa. I went and asked for a side of their spicy salsa and brought it back and realized that I already had it on my salad but it didn't have much heat to it. 

The girls working were so nice and they offered us some samples of their meat but they were out of beef so we were only able to try the chicken and pork. 

I think this place could be excellent if they got their seasoning down and cooking time on the veggies right. Unfortunately, that wasn't the case at this time. 

They also gave us a sample of their coconut dessert bar and that was the only thing I ate that was properly salted. A dessert bar...

I tried a couple different tacos but my favorite was the Khalua pork . It was juicy and the perfect saltiness level. They gave me a raspberry hot sauce too which was really good. I went to the location by rainbow and Sahara

We LOVE this place! My husband and I were both regulars of the Rainbow location and we were so beyond excited when we found out about the Warm Springs location because it's right down the street from our house. I wish I could remember her name, but the girl at the front counter on Black Friday was the sweetest! She went above and beyond with service and helped us extra with our two little ones. We love being able to support a local business too. Props to Braddahs!

The idea of a Hawaiian infused Mexican style eatery is genius.. It's like chipotle but with Hawaiian options. I always get the sea weed rice and the Kalua pig. It's some of the best I've ever had. Just the right amount of salt and flavor. I've tried a lot of Kalua pig around town and this is definitely the best! They have good salsa too. I like the mild pineapple one. A must try if you like Hawaiian food.

Food is good   service was quick   they let you sample    same style as chipotles with the Hawaiian flare   Groupon makes it very doable   prices are already really fair   get the coconut bark dessert   it's award winning and you'll see why

I don't know what to think. O got one taco. One one hand it was huge and I got to choose everything on it. On the other hand because I got to choose it wasn't very good. And the worst part is there is no hot sauce to put on the tacos. They have mild medium and hot options but it's more of a relish than a sauce and I need sauce. Especially since this is cafe rio style and the meat can get dry and you have rice that starches it up... Other than the music and atmosphere nothing seemed Hawaiian. Hawaiian flavors are distinct and if you're going for Hawaiian food that's what you want. So... I might go back might not. Probably just go to cafe rio since it tastes better.

I've been here a few times and haven't had a disappointed meal yet. This place is a mix of L&L and Chipotle, so if you like both restaurants, you like Bradduh's!

FOOD:
The chicken and pulled pork are very flavorful. I've never tried the brown rice because the seaweed rice is absolutely delicious and compliments the meats. My go-to is usually the bowl - seaweed rice, cabbage, meat, corn salsa, tomato salsa, and jalapeño. The tacos are a good choice too. If you've haven't already, try the coconut bark. It's pretty tasty but I stay away from sweets usually!

QUALITY:
Overall, I think the quality of the food is fresh for the most part but I have noticed some gristly chicken pieces and old corn in the corn salsa. Just throw out the old stuff!!!!

PRICE:
$ - my bowl cost about $7.50. They have an affordable lunch special for $5.00. 

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
The servers are usually friendly. I went in when I lost my voice one time and the server was very understanding in that moment. 

Overall, this is a great to-go place. I like the food and it's location is convenient for me - next to my crossfit box and house. I def will be a regular.
Always great customer service,  everyone is friendly and they truly appreciate their customers. Being from the islands,  I can say they definitely pass on the Aloha spirit!
Food was so yummy! It's like chipotle but with Hawaiian food! More flavor too! Staff was very friendly and nice. Can't believe I haven't heard about them before when they have 4 other locations.

I was really excited to try Braddahs because I'm always on the hunt for good fish tacos. I heard this place has great ones, it was closer to me than rubios, so I gave it a try. 
It has a chipotle-like ordering style where you pick everything you want in and on your food. 
I got the three fish tacos to go with the hottest salsa available, black beans, cheese, cabbage, and fresh jalapeños. 
When I got home I thought they looked nice but when I bit into them it was so underwhelming. The salsa wasn't even hot, the fish was dry and bland. The black beans were good but that's about it. Seriously the fish was so dry I couldn't even bite through it. 
If you're looking for a decent fish taco avoid this place. 

-------

UPDATE: so I complained to them via Twitter about their meal and instead of acknowledging the terrible meal I had, THEY BLOCKED ME! So I will literally never be back to this poorly run establishment, not that I was going to anyway. 
How does a business get WORSE than chipotle? Please enlighten me, the meal was truly awful.

This place is amazing! Ordered a chicken salad with sesame dressing, steak soft tacos and a steak burrito, the flavors were awesome! The coconut bark was so good, not too sweet or chewy. 
Definitely will be visiting this place often, very happy this location is near Mountains Edge.

This is my third yime coming here and I love it. My fav so far is the Kalua pork tacos. The flavor of the meat goes so well with the salsa (pineapple chared) . I literally cant get enough,of it, and I have to say the bark is also a must try!

Like a Hawaiian Chipotle...pretty much sums the place up. Got a flyer in the mail about Braddah's and since I was wanting to try a place I'd never been to before, I decided to try them out with a to go order. Decor is tidy and clean, and the staff was friendly.

Now, even though this place is LIKE a Chipotle, you have to remember that Hawaiian food is not like Mexican food, and so you have to build your bowl a little differently. I, however, did not make that distinction initially and paid the price by ending up with a bowl of very random tastes which did not entirely play nice together. Cheese and Kalua Pig do not mix! And guac doesn't particularly work with the salsa I chose either.

I had one big complaint, and that was the container used for my bowl. I'm not a stickler for how my food is presented, but a change is needed here. My "bowl" was a clear rectangular plastic container. The server, bless her heart, crammed, and I mean CRAMMED, this cube as full of food as she could. The sight of all the food just smashed in there was just unappetizing! Then, when I got home, all the guac stuck to the lid with the cheese and lettuce as well. Ick. Hopefully the dine in bowls are better, but the to go bowls need to be more like Chipotle or Zabas.

Food quality was good, however, and I'd say most of my negatives were actually my fault for not asking for the right combination of ingredients. I'll definitely give them another try, as the chicken looked delicious.

I'm a Hawaiian native and that was the worst Hawaiian food I have ever had. The restaurant was filthy, the employees were uninformed, the food tasted like it had been sitting there for a couple days, and to top it off there was a huge black HAIR in one of our bowls. We were both so grossed out that we just walked out and left all of our food. Would never even give it a try again.
Convenient and close! Love this place!!! Food is always good and service is amazing! My go to braddahs
I ordered the kalua pig with seaweed rice. It was good, not great, but good. The meat was a bit cold. Their sauces are yummy and that coconut bark tho... I'd come back for the bark.

Food is so delicious! It was my first time visiting this establishment. The staff was very helpful and his recommendation was on point! Thank you for the extraordinary service and I will be back to try other dishes!

Love it. First time and will come back when in vegas. Had the tacos, wife had Bowl with pork. Very tasty. Server let's us sample every thing so we made a better choice for our meals. Located in small not busy corner center. Construction on street diverts your attention from the place. The coconut bark was awesome. Everything was good. Highly recommend.  Might be tight fit for larger groups

I have tried Braddah's a couple times now. It has been underwhelming each time. Food was bland. Salsa not spicy. Very small portions. It's not terrible but when I'm craving a burrito or bowl this place won't be the first one to come to mind.

Hawaii meets chipotle. 

This place has the set up of chipotle (walk down a line and they pile on the food for your) but the flavor profile of Hawaii. Pretty cheap price for a good amount of food. The flavor was decent, a bit bland and lacking flavor for my taste. Pork was mediocre but the chicken was moist and flavorful. The restaurant itself was very clean and organized. The staff was very friendly. I would definitely come back just because the staff was so nice. This place is a quick place to grab lunch and head back to work.

So much food for a pretty cheap price. The meat melts in your mouth. It's so yummy. It's set up like Chipotle but way more yummy. I feel like I'm in Hawaii while eating. The coconut bark is a must as well.

The pig was legit! This place is like a Hawaiian Chipotle, where you walk in and create a salad/burrito/bowl from an assembly line of delicious ingredients. I made a salad bowl with pig (I like that their menu refers to pork specifically as pig), chicken, lettuce, grilled veggies, hot salsa, and habaneros. My buddy also got chips and guac, which I shared with him.

The pig was a bit more salty than I expected, but it was really good. I like salty food, so no biggie for me. The chicken was good; not extraordinary but not bad at all. A solid showing on the chicken. The grilled veggies were grilled veggies; I wish places would give me more onion and less green bell pepper -- Chipotle has the same problem, all peppers -- but also no biggie. Veggies were cooked alright and tasted fine. Habaneros were hot. I've had some that were not quite as hot as you would expect a habanero to be, but these were not like that. I took a bite with a bunch of habanero on it and I paid the price for the rest of the meal.

The chips and guac were pretty good! I have this thing about cilantro being disgusting and I hate it, but the guac didn't have an overpowering cilantro taste like some places can. The chips were great.

So it sounds like I have a bunch of above-average things to say, why only 3 stars? Food quality. Look, Braddah's, I know I didn't come here for health food. And I know I should have certain expectations about fast food, but you don't have to rub it in my face. I looked at the kitchen area and saw a bunch of huge oil jugs. "Sesame flavored oil" -- flavored? What? You're not using sesame oil? No! Lucky for me I have 20/15 eyesight so I can read the ingredients list: Soybean oil, sesame oil. Okay great, so you want the sesame flavor because your island-style food is made with it, but you also want to make more money by using the cheapest, lowest quality oil possible (soybean) and then adding flavor to it so nobody knows. 

EXCEPT I KNOW. And now everybody that reads my review will know. So even though I liked the food well enough, and the pig and chips/guac were great, I can never get higher than 3 stars for a place that just so blatantly feeds me low quality junk. Which also makes me wonder: everything else I'm eating, what's the quality of it? I can only assume it is also poor.

My children have food allergies and the crew behind the counter were so helpful and nice.  The food was very flavorful and delicious.  The salsas were amazing and some of them I would pour on top of ice cream as a dessert!  We tried each of the items with the steak, chicken, and Kalua pork and loved each one.  They all have distinct flavor, which I would suggest to sample to find your favorite. (For me it's always steak).  We tried the coconut bark which was a dark chocolate toffee taste of decadence.  The employees were extremely friendly and made us feel very comfortable for our first time.  We will be making a return trip (probably tomorrow!).

The first thing that I noticed when I walked in was the awesome "hawaii" art work on the walls the second thing I noticed was the music. I felt like I was at pure aloha. :) 

Let's talk about the food. 
I ordered the pulehu steak burrito. It's  yummy. I never had seaweed rice before so I was a bit nervous but I was pleasantly surprised. 

I just wish the construction on warmsprings was done already. It was tricky getting into the parking lot. But that's nothing the restaurant's problem.

Four stars for the fourth location of a favorite local chain! Customize bowls, burritos, salads, and even nachos with Hawaiian-style proteins and fresh house-made hot sauces. Service is as friendly as the mainland and prices are easy on the wallet.

The grilled fish or huli huli chicken, on a salad or bowl, are go-to meals for me. Always ask for seaweed rice, grilled veggies, and the pineapple-tomatillo salsa for a party that'll break your mouth. Dining room is pretty small, but on nice days opt for the lanai tables outside!

So . I live close by Braddah's and had be waiting for it to open. The day it opened I went I had a wonderful experience, friendly service good portions,good food! I couldn't be happier with my first experience. I went again, it was good. Hoping to make this a regular spot for me  the next time I had a bad experience. I had friendly service but was over charged and the portion size decreased and I felt like i got ripped off. No meat no veggies, I wasnt going to go back. My roommate wanted to go , I said  I'd go in. They asked me if i I wanted anything after she started to order. I said no , She said ok may i ask why ? I told her the experience i had and Tia was her name , she insisted on buying me lunch to right the wrong that had happened. Then to top off her excellent service the manager Chris came over apologized and added in the most amazing dessert  "coconut bark" . MMMMMMM. I dont write reviews often but, they blew me away with how quick they were willing to right the wrong. With a smile to top that off.

Thank you I will be back!!!!

I Love Braddahs and have gone to their other locations and have never had a problem. When I saw this location opened I was very excited to go! We walked in; and even though there were about five people behind the counter the girl serving the patron ahead of us was the only one to say Hi. Two other girls walk in after us; and one of them apparently worked there, but was off that day. As I was finishing up getting my bowl together the girl behind us gets behind the counter and serves herself and her friend, while my cousin stands there waiting for her turn to be served. It was extremely awkward and unprofessional! I got my bowl & paid and my cousin was still waiting to place her order. Come on Braddahs you're better than this! Let's just say I won't be returning to this location.

I love that there is now a Braddah's on this side of town. It is a Chipotle style menu but with Hawaiian options. Fish is my preferred protein and I am happy to have a place to grab a quick bite that offers an alternative to the standard chicken & steak. 

I always have the salad with the yummy pineapple green salsa. The fish is always cooked to perfection, seasoned & moist. I have had this dish 3x this week already! 

The pumpkin bark is also a new favorite of mine.

I travel to Hawaii often and was glad to see a Hawaiian food themed place open up close to me after reading about it the the Las Vegas Sun magazine. I've been twice and both times have had the tacos. Pork, Chicken and beef I have tried. Unfortuantly my stomach has been upset after each visit within 30 minutes. I wondered if it was a certain sauce I tried the first time, but the same thing happened after the second visit with different sauce and ingredients. My first visit there were 2 young employees (guys) in uniform hats and shirts hanging around the register on the customer side, but were not interacting with customers and seemed bothered when one customer asked a question. Manager was there also behind the counter and on the floor and was pleasant when I spoke to her. 
My second visit was saturday night 8pm on Sept 5th and there was only 1 employee (a young girl) working by herself. I saw a cook at one time, but the young girl was doing everything by herself and there was a line of 6 people to order. She was very polite when it was my turn to order and assisted me and offered a sample if I wanted one of the steak. I was disappointed that the homemade ranch dressing was not in stock, but I then opted for the non spicy salsa.

I recently discovered this place and fell in love with it. It's like Chipotle and LL Hawaiian had a child together, and the outcome was perfect. I highly recommend the Kalua Pig on tacos, spicy salsa and brown rice and beans, cilantro and sour cream, and cheese. So good!

Ordered the 2 tacos and a drink , my rice choice was brown rice which it was hard and super dry , with Huli Huli chicken , cheese and sour cream . I was super stoked to try out this place considering I was born and raised in Hawaii now living in Vegas when I heard of braddahs I thought "cheeeee, gotta try this place out". So disappointed in the taste of my chicken not only did it not taste like huli huli but i had burnt dry pieces in my taco .
Amazing customer service!! Everyone looks happy and its great to see!! Service is quick and food is always on point!!! Make sure to come by and try them out if you havent!

I got a chicken bowl with lettuce, seaweed rice, and the mango and corn salsa. It wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be. 

The rice was kinda hard, and the chicken is a bit salty...

Overall, I thought it was a cool idea to mix Hawaiian and Mexican together. I'm not sure if I'd come back though.
Customer service is excellent, I ordered their chicken burrito. They have a wide selection of fruity styled hot sauces. The food was great, service great. Hey,  support these guys, good stuff here
Super friendly staff and the food was soooo yummy. I love the steak and my boyfriend loves the pulled pork. Can't go wrong!

Not worth a second visit.
Food was nothing special. The "spiciest" salsa was pretty bland. The kid working the food bar was nice and offered us samples, (thus the two stars); but seemed like he was all over the place. We assumed he might be new and gave him benefit of the doubt. The way the food was being handled to prepare our nachos seemed kinda amateur and unprofessional/ untrained. They definitely need to work on flavor and food handling practices.

I do not understand some of the bad reviews. . .I guess I am confused as I have been here multiple times and all the times that I have been here. . .I have had the best service as well as good qualtiy food.  Maybe I was lucky???  Who knows!  =)

Either way, I love love this place!  It has a grea Hawaiian vibe to it when you walk in. . .all the decor is Hawaiian and the staff are definitely friendly like I expect the Hawaiians to be!  LOL  Adn it's right down the street from me. . .PERFECT!  =)

My bf still prefers Chipotle but for me. . .I would much rather goto Braddah's!  =)  The flavors just rocks it for me. . .=)

Anyhow, onto the food.  

IF it is your first time, let them know that it is your first time, they will give you little bites of the meat so that you can taste before you buy!  Good deal huh?

I normally hate chicken and will not eat it anywhere else unless it is deep fried. . .BUT here the chicken is sooooo freaking good!  Juicy with just the right amount of char to give that extra kick of flavor.  I have had it on a salad, burrito and nachos. . .and they have all been delicious!  I've liked the chicken so much from the beginning that I have not wanted to eat any other meat there. . .so my reccomendation is to get the chicken!  =D

Also, they give samples of the bark that they have currently in stock. . .ok I admit it. . .it is UGLY to look at.  But like the saying goes. . .don't judge a book by its cover. . .well don't judge until you eat one. . .very good!!  I tend to like salty sweet desserts and they have just the right balance.  =)

Last but not least. . .if you want some kick in your food. . .don't just get the salsas. . .ask them to add on habaneros to your dish. . .=)  I have had the habaneros and some were spicy and some were not. . .but they sure do add a lot more kick them the salsas do.  =)

One of these days, I will order the other meats. . .but for now. . .this is my goto place for chicken!  =)
